page.title: 01BILLERICAY NW_Introduction
page.content: The region consists mainly of an area of farming, interspersed with patches of woodland. It extends from the outskirts of{Hutton}to{Billericay, and includes much of the Parish of {Mountnessing.}The landscape is generally flat and stands some 50m above sea level, being drained by the {River Wid}and its subsidiary streams, flowing NE. The population in the N and W is sparse, being settled around a dozen farms.{Mountnessing Hall}and the adjacent{Church}are dominant features in the area. The SE corner of the grid includes the expanding{Queens Park Estate,} which is a recent extension of an established residential area. In recent years, light industry has grown up around the{Billericay Railway {Station.}
